name: Jackson's Hotel

reviews.text: Arrived on d 1st of Nov stayed 2nites wud of loved to have stayed more. lovely warm family atmosphere, staff where more than helpful food was grt. Kids loved it i defiantly don't hav any negative things to say about tis hotel. Look forward to seeing yous again
reviews.title: Great family hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Jackson's Hotel on a group tour of Ireland. The hotel had been compared to Fawlty Towers and after struggling to find our room because signage was incorrect, then seeing the room furnishings, we had to agree. Members of our group wandered the hallways for a good 10 minutes before finally locating our rooms - I was just glad we hadn't been drinking adult beverages.
reviews.title: Eclectically Furnished

reviews.text: The room furnishngs were ecletic - nothing remotely matched. If they were going for the look that the room had been decorated with the furniture from four different hotels that went out of business within the last 20-30 years, they succeeded. The carpet appeared to have been there a very long time - with alternating 3 inch square floral patterns.
reviews.title: You can't always rely on reviews!!!
Worst hotel ever
reviews.text: There was a king headboard on the wall, but the room had a double bed and a twin. The bases of the two beds was different - one was purple and the other burgundy. The mattresses have seen some wear, as there were indentations and they were not comfortable and offered little support. The bedding was another one of those wretched all-in-one duvets BUT it had a very welcome sheet so we didn't have to make the choice beween too much or no bedding. The room was uncomfortably warm and we were unable to make it cooler - this was a common issue with most of us on the tour.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The furniture and cabinetry of the room was all old and battered. The window treatments were sheers that were longer than the window by about 18 inches, but 18 inches from the floor. The "curtains" were made of navy, floral fabric that you could see through but weren't entirely sheer. The 3 side chairs had a cotton velour fabric with alternating gold stripes with gold stripes with black pindots. The wallpaper had a beige background with a floral design. There was a very small TV on a wall mount.
reviews.title: Quality Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having enjoyed a pleasant stay at Jackson's Hotel around 3 years ago my wife and I were looking forward to a return for a long weekend, but this time a few small but avoidable issues made for a disappointing visit.
reviews.title: Disappointing return visit

reviews.text: Having booked a Deluxe Double room we were given Room 401. The hotel is large and our room - and I believe all of the Deluxe rooms - was in the new part of the hotel, quite far away from reception. This wasn’t a problem for us, but for less able-bodied people the journey to the room might be too far, comprising as it does 2 elevator rides and several long corridors. The room was of a good size, with a large comfortable bed, lots of storage space and a clean, modern bathroom. There was also a huge patio/balcony area through some sliding french windows. However there was a very noticeable smell of smoke upon entering the room - I believe smoking rooms are available at the hotel but we had not requested one - and the patio/balcony area was covered in cigarette butts and half empty pint glasses.
reviews.title: Great break away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The wi-fi in the room could only be accessed from the bathroom, despite a router being located 20 yards away in the corridor. Also our room must have been positioned over a side entrance door as banging and shouting could be heard all night. Screaming matches also took place in the corridor outside our room every 15 minutes from about from midnight until 2am. I appreciate that Jackons is a very large hotel and there's little that staff can do about this issue if not alerted to it but it did disrupt our sleep. Also the hotel booklet advises guests to use their in-room telephone to call other rooms by simply dialling the room number, but in our case the room number - 401 - happened to be the same as the telephone number guests were to call to get through to the hotel bar! This led to a couple of calls to our room - one at 3am - asking for room service.
reviews.title: Not even worthy of 1 star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the plus side the breakfast buffet was quite good - I'd advise arriving before 9:30 though as the queue when we exited the dining hall at around 9:45 was about 20 deep - and the staff, all very young, were generally pleasant. And it's pretty cheap.
reviews.title: Another great stay
Weekend break with family and dog.
reviews.text: Stayed in this hotel for three nights over Halloween break, with my three children. Had a great time. Kids loved the kids club and I enjoyed a few hours to myself. Breakfast was great every am and food in restaurant never disappointed us and had a great cosy atmosphere. Would definitely come again. Visited some beautiful places slieve league , silver strand near glencolmcille and was only 40mins from Derry Halloween parade which was brilliant.
Our review is based on a family break for 8 adults 2 toddlers and 2 babies (3 generations of family) for 3 nights in Oct 2013
reviews.title: Exceptionally warm & welcoming atmosphere

reviews.text: Staff
reviews.title: NYPD Gaelic football team Donegal trip

reviews.text: all the staff were very helpful, friendly and always on hand to cater for the needs of our group
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel and Staff

reviews.text: Facilties
reviews.title: Excellent hotel great staff and even better local food on the menu

reviews.text: The rooms were comfortable and spacious.
reviews.title: the delights of County Donegal

reviews.text: We arrived at the Jackson on Oct. 3, 2013 for four nights stay with a Celtic Tours group. The tour advertised the Kees hotel across the river, but switched us (that will be in another review). Check in was pretty smooth and they were well prepared until we arrived at our rooms door, room 165 in the old part of the hotel. I tried both hey cards and neither of them would work. So I left my wife in the hall with all of our luggage and made the long walk to the desk. On my way, I encountered two other women on our tour trying to get into their room and could not. They said they had an actual key, but the lock was broken and they were working on it. The desk lady gave me two new key cards and I walked back to the room. Neither of these keys would open the door either. I again walked to the desk and by now I was getting pretty wore out and very hot since they had the heat on in the building. I told her I either wanted a key card that would open the door or a different room as I was tired of running back and forth. She then programed 3 keys and said she would go up with me. She got to the door and the first card opened the door. She left and I tried the 3 cards myself. Only two of them worked and the third one didn't, so out of 7 different key cards, only 2 worked.
reviews.title: Might be 4 star in the new part, but not in the old part of the hotel

reviews.text: The room was very warm since as I said, the heat was on in the building. I looked for an air conditioner.....none. We opened the windows and I turned the steam off to the radiator so it would not cook us out.
reviews.title: Excellent stay for line dancing weekend

reviews.text: The room was strangely decorated with a theme somewhere between Ireland and Africa. Looks like they just threw whatever furniture was left over and not broken into the old part of the hotel. The TV remote didn't work, which wasn't a huge deal since we only turned it on a couple of times for a brief period to get a weather forecast. When we booked the trip I had requested a queen or king bed. The room had a single bed (the headboard was just loose and tipped against the wall) and a double bed that had a huge sag in it from thousands of butts over the years. I was afraid that the bed would kill our backs, but it was actually relatively comfortable to my surprise. The sheets were newer and clean, but the bed spread was showing a great deal of wear. I found the hair dryer for my wife mounted in the top drawer of the dresser. When she did use it, it was pretty lame. I thought it did fairly well for a 1960s model ;-)
reviews.title: Can't fault it...!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom was not as clean as I would have expected for a 4 star hotel. There was mold and dirt scattered throughout the entire tile area of the tub. I know this is what it was because I took my wash cloth and scrubbed some of it off the first time I showered. The tub was narrow at the bottom and quite a slope to the drain. There was no anti slip stuff left on the bottom of the tub and the first time I stepped in, I nearly took a spill. Had to be extremely careful or risk falling and breaking bones.
reviews.title: Happy

reviews.text: The sink in the bath had very old fixtures and you had to screw them out about 2 full revolutions before the water would start to come out. The toilet when flushed dumped about 3 gallons of water, but almost always had to be flushed twice as there was always toilet paper that would not go down. There were no plug ins in the bathroom at all for my wife's curling iron and etc.
reviews.title: Excellence in Ireland

description: Nestled in the bustling village of Ballybofey, Jacksons Hotel is an award-winning Hotel on the banks of the River Finn and Drumboe Woods. Renowned for its hospitality and great food, Jacksons is the ideal base for touring Donegal and the North West of Ireland.
